title: pakhitheboss
author: pakhitheboss
content: While browsing, I thought! Why not check what is the best gambling quote? To my surprise, there was one out of many shown by Google and instantly that quote made me relate to Bitcointalk, the gambling board. Instantly I realized we need a thread wherein we all can post gambling quotes that make a difference and share positivity. I know many would not agree with it. But, as a gambler, we are adamant about what we do and we know our efforts will someday give us huge profits. I hope every one of us makes something huge. Here is my quote for today!QuoteGambling is the future of the internet. You can only look at so many dirty pictures.” – Simon NoblePlease follow the above format. If it is your quote please add your Bitcointalk username after your quote.2023 editions mean this year! As next year might bring more issues. I thought of a new thread if possible.

comments.author: pakhitheboss
comments.created_time: January 23, 2023, 04:04:55 PMLast edit: January 31, 2023, 02:33:53 PM by pakhitheboss
comments.body: After watching so many good quotes on this thread I am now going to post the top 3 quotes here. I do not think there is any reason for me to post a quote by me as you gems of this thread have done an absolutely awesome job. I have gone through all the replies and here are the three favorites of mine for this week. WEEK-1Quote from: coin-investor on January 23, 2023, 11:36:34 PMQuote“Hoping to recoup is what ruins the gambler.”– Baltasar Gracián y Morales, a 17th century philosopher.Quote from: decodx on January 24, 2023, 11:50:55 PMQuote"A man's gotta make at least one bet a day, else he could be walking around lucky and never know it." –  Quote from: virasisog on January 25, 2023, 05:49:52 AMQuote Expectation is the root of all heartache. These are my favorite Positive Gambling Quotes. I would love to read an original quote. Please try to quote something which is yours as most members are capable to do one.

comments.author: coin-investor
comments.body: This is my contribution to this thread there are actually lots of good ones but this one is personal and still trying to apply to my gambling session. “Hoping to recoup is what ruins the gambler.”Quote“Hoping to recoup is what ruins the gambler.”– Baltasar Gracián y Morales, a 17th century philosopher.I'm surprised that this philosophy already exists in the 17th century I thought, just recently or in our generation where gambling is very rampant.

comments.author: Hispo
comments.body: I searched on Google and found many interesting quotes, however, this one caught my attention, because it is simple, short and it is something I believe we all can agree on. I am leaving the name of webpage where I found this quote, in case any of you want to check it out. Quote"This was my first lesson about gambling: if you see somebody winning all the time, he isn't gambling, he's cheating. ” – MALCOLM X Source: notable-quotes

comments.author: michellee
comments.body: I tried searching on Google and found these quotes:Quote“There is a lure in power. It can get into a man's blood just as gambling and lust for money have been known to do.” ― Harry S. Truman.It seems to be true that he said that gambling is a great attraction that can get into a person, even if he was not interested in gambling before. Everything is because of money. And if it's because of money, everyone must be eager to have it one way or another. But we humans can control ourselves well and it depends on whether we want it or not.

comments.author: uneng
comments.body: Quote“Gambling is not about how well you play the games, it’s really about how well you handle your money.”Poker Player V. P. PappyThis is a powerful message every gamblers have to learn before or while their games' sessions. Nobody survive for too long in gambling without proper money management, and those who think it's not important, start playing randomly going busted much faster than a responsible gambler who premeditate his steps during the game, potentially going bankrupt and becoming addicted, if they aren't careful and attentive to what they are doing.

comments.author: aioc
comments.body: Quote"It's hard to walk away from a winning streak, even harder to leave the table when you're on a losing one." - Cara Bertoia, Cruise Quarters - a Novel About Casinos and Cruise ShipsThis quote reflects the experiences some gamblers are facing when they are playing, winning, or losing its hard to make a decision you either continue the momentum or lose everything, I'm sure the majority of gamblers are experiencing this one time or many times while playing.

comments.author: crwth
comments.body: I searched the internet, and this is what I found interesting.Quote from: https://www.inspiringquotes.us/quotes/G0Fm_1zlHyFc0Gambling: The sure way of getting nothing for something - Wilson MiznerThis is just having a good time and not taking it too seriously. It should just be a form of entertainment and not earn from it. I believe some people treat it that way, and I think this is a great positive quote to remind us that it's for entertainment and to have fun and enjoy, not a way to get rich quickly.

comments.author: elevates
comments.body: I also did a Google search and found this one to be the best for me. I think some or many members might relate to this quote. Quote“Money won is twice as sweet as money earned.”  This is so true, the happiness and the sense of satisfaction that you get when you win money are far better than the money earned. That happiness doubles when the amount you won is more than your earnings. Picked it up from here.

comments.author: Daltonik
comments.body: It is not surprising that a lot of statements about gambling belong to great and outstanding minds, because they themselves loved to play for money, for example, a quote from the novel The Queen of Spades:Quote"Play interests me very much,” said Hermann: “but I am not in the position to sacrifice the necessary in the hope of winning the superfluous.” – A.S. Pushkin

comments.author: Yatsan
comments.body: Quotes are good to keep you going but since we are going through different circumstances, its application would be different to some. Also, no matter how many quotes a player has, if he won't foolow into those statements, nothing will really happen. Most of the gambling quotes are accepting the bitter outcome of playing which is something a player cannot really do since everyone has the urge to win. In such instances addiction and negative playing behavior arise. Perhaps the quote "Only gamble an amount you can afford losing" wherein there's really no amount to many of us, which could be accepted easily if you lose. Therefore, quotes could only be a guidance but it will still depend on the player to how will he/she make use of it or his personal principles.

comments.body: QuoteIf you must play,decide upon three things at the start:the rules of the game,the stakes,and the quitting time.Chinese ProverbThe only sure thing about luck isthat it will change.Bret Harte(1836-1902; American author and poet) This is my best gambling quote and again ops thank you for creating this thread at least this reminds us of some important quotes from histories of great gamblers and philosophers that have made some vital statement. comments.author: danherbias07
comments.body: How about this one from Star Wars. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=uYX-NSZMqt0C-3PO: “Sir, the possibility of successfully navigating an asteroid field is approximately 3,720 to 1.”Han Solo: “Never tell me the odds.”Brings back memories.Probably best for lotto gamblers. Most of them don't know their odds of winning, so it's best not to tell them or they might stop betting.  Good thread OP, I learned a lot from different quotes that are shared.Now, I think I am going to watch Star Wars again from the start. Will prepare lots of popcorn.

comments.author: decodx
comments.body: Here is a quote that I find particularly amusing:Quote"A man's gotta make at least one bet a day, else he could be walking around lucky and never know it." – Horace A. "Jimmy" JonesThis quote is a playful and humorous way of expressing the idea that taking risks is a part of life, and that by not taking risks, one might miss out on potential opportunities. It's suggesting that it's important to take risks and try new things in life, to discover what the fate holds for you.

comments.author: Wiwo
comments.body: Quote from: elevates on January 24, 2023, 07:51:42 AMQuote“Money won is twice as sweet as money earned.”  This positive quote reminds me of a situation witnessing local lottery games sometime last week, where the winner was making his acceptance speech, he said and I quote, I have not won anything before and everything I ever hard, I worked hard for it. This quote goes along with the quote above that money won is sweeter than money earned, but then how long can we depend on luck to give us a desired constant result, I guess your answer is the same as mine.  We have to learn how to manage risk by limiting our level of positivity and dependence on continuous luck, which is not provable for long-term sake, it is good to be positive and lucky but not forget the technicality involved in winning a game from a casino.
